publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2249 Robin Harper: Scottish Environment Week in the Parliament, 7 to 13 February 2005—That the Parliament welcomes the forthcoming Scottish Environment Week in Holyrood from 7 to 13 February 2005 which will focus on the importance of the environment and its value to the society and economy of Scotland; welcomes the opportunity to celebrate our rich and diverse natural and cultural heritage, to acknowledge the active involvement of people across the country in caring for the environment in their own communities and workplaces and to showcase sustainable development successes in practice, and looks forward to the exhibition and events throughout that week which will bring people together to look towards challenges and opportunities in securing the well-being of our environment and our future. Supported by: Shiona Baird*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Chris Ballance*, Mark Ballard*, Patrick Harvie*, Eleanor Scott*

S2M-2249 Robin Harper: Scottish Environment Week in the Parliament, 7 to 13 February 2005—That the Parliament welcomes the forthcoming Scottish Environment Week in Holyrood from 7 to 13 February 2005 which will focus on the importance of the environment and its value to the society and economy of Scotland; welcomes the opportunity to celebrate our rich and diverse natural and cultural heritage, to acknowledge the active involvement of people across the country in caring for the environment in their own communities and workplaces and to showcase sustainable development successes in practice, and looks forward to the exhibition and events throughout that week which will bring people together to look towards challenges and opportunities in securing the well-being of our environment and our future. Supported by: Shiona Baird, Mr Mark Ruskell, Chris Ballance, Mark Ballard, Patrick Harvie, Eleanor Scott
S2M-2249 Scottish Environment Week in the Parliament, 7 to 13 February 2005 (lodged on 12 January 2005) Maureen Macmillan*, Pauline McNeill*, Susan Deacon*, Donald Gorrie*
